words.name: gripgrasping
words.definition: trying to find something; reaching for something

words.name: humongolacity
words.definition: largeness or importance of an object

words.name: pentapriests
words.definition: the group of 5 priests that makes up the high island council

words.name: confabettes
words.definition: a small group of people who attend an informal meeting; combination of "confab" (small, informal meeting) and "-ette" (French suffix meaning small or dainty).

words.name: multypritude
words.definition: one who enjoys writing

words.name: town baa-baas
words.definition: people who are not strong enough to resist the commands of an authority if needed; it compares townspeople to sheep, which say "baa," and how the mammals are herded by their shepherd without trying to escape

words.name: spinal-defectives
words.definition: weak, cowardly; probably derived from "spineless," hence "spinal," and defectives are those who turn their backs to their community

words.name: crepuscular-to-auroric
words.definition: from sun down to sun up; a curfew; crepuscular means twilight and aurora is the Latin word for dawn

words.name: dull-brass-and-pauper's-punch
words.definition: without proof; blunt; uninformed; dull brass could be used in some kind of blunt weapon-instead of diplomacy being the goal of a

words.name: bastinado-beneficed
words.definition: of being harsh or brutal in the of a religious entity; bastinado means caning a parson's feet and a benefice is a permanent religious appointment

words.name: elision
words.definition: omission of a sound in a word or a passage in a book

words.name: alacrity
words.definition: being eager, cheerful readiness

words.name: mellifluous
words.definition: melodious, pleasant to the ear

words.name: deracinating
words.definition: tearing something up completely

words.name: pyrrhic
words.definition: (of a success) won, but was not worth the price for the victor

words.name: scintilla
words.definition: very small; tiny, brilliant flash or spark

words.name: cenotaph
words.definition: a monument for a deceased person that is not located at the site of the tomb

words.name: portiere
words.definition: a curtain that blocks off the doorway

words.name: grapheme
words.definition: a letter or character that make up the smallest part of a language

words.name: appell
words.definition: "roll call," German
